content.en: Bio-inspired robotics: Scientists have been using algorithms to study the mechanics of fish swimming and develop bio-inspired underwater robots. They have used computational fluid dynamics and other algorithms to understand the maneuverability of fish and the hydrodynamic effects of bionic undulating robots. By optimizing the shape and design of fins, they have improved swimming efficiency and control. These studies provide valuable insights into the physical mechanisms behind fish locomotion and can help in the development of autonomous underwater vehicles.
content.da: Bio-inspirerede robotter: Forskere har brugt algoritmer til at studere mekanikken bag fiskenes svømning og udvikle bio-inspirerede undervandsrobotter. De har brugt computervæskedynamik og andre algoritmer for at forstå fiskenes manøvreevne og de hydrodynamiske effekter af bioniske bølgende robotter. Ved at optimere form og design af finner har de forbedret svømmeeffektiviteten og kontrollen. Disse studier giver værdifuld indsigt i de fysiske mekanismer bag fiskenes bevægelse og kan hjælpe med udviklingen af autonome undervandsfartøjer.
